examples.text: Starting salary varies from £26 000 to £30 500, depending on experience.
He either resigned or was sacked, depending on who you talk to.

definitions.definition: used to say that you are not certain about something because other things have to be considered

examples.text: ‘Is he coming?’ ‘That depends. He may not have the time.’
I don't know if we can help—it all depends.
I might not go. It depends how tired I am.
‘Your job sounds fun.’ ‘It depends what you mean by “fun”.’
I shouldn't be too late. But it depends if the traffic's bad.

wordOrigin: late Middle English originally meaning ‘to hang down’; (also in the sense ‘wait or be in suspense’): from Old French dependre, from Latin dependere, from de- ‘down’ + pendere ‘hang’.
